d3.js on Jekyll

Intro

So, d3.js has been around for a moment now and I guess it’s good time to start playing with it!

Trivia

It needs extra steps implementing d3.js onto Jekyll, especially when we’re working on Markdown instead of HTML. But, with proper anchor, it’s like taking a candy from a baby. Cheers.
